problem_statement: The project requires the development of a high-throughput backend service called SentinelProcessor that ingests raw application crash reports and aggregates them into logical issues. In production systems, a single bug can trigger thousands of near-identical crash logs per second, leading to a phenomenon known as Issue Explosion. The core challenge is to implement a deterministic fingerprinting algorithm that extracts a stable signature from messy, unstructured stack traces. This signature must remain identical even when volatile data such as timestamps, specific memory addresses, varying file paths, or ephemeral session IDs differs between individual report instances. The service must efficiently group these reports in-memory and provide a mechanism to trigger notifications only when a truly new bug is detected or when a recurring bug exceeds a specific frequency threshold.
FAIL_TO_PASS: tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should strip hex memory addresses
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should strip absolute unix file paths
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should strip windows file paths
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should strip line and column numbers
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should strip UUIDs
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should strip long timestamps
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should collapse whitespace
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – normalizeText::should return empty string for non-string input
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – fingerprint stability::should produce identical fingerprints for logically identical stack traces from different environments
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – fingerprint stability::should produce identical fingerprints when only memory addresses differ
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – fingerprint stability::should produce different fingerprints for genuinely different errors
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – fingerprint stability::should return a fallback fingerprint for empty inputs
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FingerprintEngine – fingerprint stability::should be deterministic across repeated calls
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::ErrorStore::should create a new entry on first upsert
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::ErrorStore::should increment hit count on duplicate fingerprint
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::ErrorStore::should track highest severity
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::ErrorStore::should preserve first seen timestamp
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::ErrorStore::should return null for unknown fingerprints

tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::ErrorStore::should list all issues via getAll
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FrequencyMonitor::should track velocity within the rolling window
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FrequencyMonitor::should prune timestamps outside the rolling window
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FrequencyMonitor::should detect bursting when threshold is exceeded
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FrequencyMonitor::should not report burst below threshold
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FrequencyMonitor::should return 0 velocity for unknown fingerprints
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FrequencyMonitor::should not report burst for unknown fingerprints
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::FrequencyMonitor::should correctly count burst window hits
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::NotificationDispatcher::should dispatch notification for new fingerprint exactly once

tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::NotificationDispatcher::should track notification log
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::SentinelProcessor – integration::should ingest a report and create a new issue
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::SentinelProcessor – integration::should aggregate duplicate errors under same fingerprint
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::SentinelProcessor – integration::should fire new-issue notification on first occurrence
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::SentinelProcessor – integration::should fire burst notification when threshold exceeded
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::SentinelProcessor – integration::should handle malformed/null reports gracefully
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::SentinelProcessor – integration::should handle reports with missing fields
tests/sentinel-processor.test.js::SentinelProcessor – integration::should aggregate same logical error from different containers
